channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3434] Chat Roulette Funny Piano Improv #2
item.description: Your host, Merton, freestyling in real-time with random strangers on Chat Roulette. Video #2.

item.title: [+2415] Student Uses Westboro Baptist to Raise Funds for Gay Rights
item.description: [VIDEO] Jason beats the Westboro Baptist Church. He doesn't agree with standing across the street and yelling, because that doesn't have the power to change anything. Instead of greeting a hateful message with an anti-hateful message, he used Westboro's presence to raise funds for gay-rights organizations. Well done, Jason.

item.title: [+2312] Apple joins Fox News boycott
item.description: According to a Washington Post story by Howard Kurtz, about 200 advertisers have "joined a boycott" of Glenn Beck's program, with Apple abandoning Fox News altogether.

item.title: [+1878] 22 Most Unusual Google Earth Photos
item.description: Google Earth lets you fly anywhere on the Earth to view satellite images, maps, terrain, 3D buildings, from galaxies in outer space to the canyons of the ocean. You can explore rich geographical content, save your toured places and share with others.

item.title: [+1869] This is how you clean a Ferrari [GIF]
[+1702] Anderson Cooper to Tackle Scientology in New Series
item.description: Anderson Cooper is launching a weeklong series about Scientology Monday, looking at the controversial religion's “history of violence,” especially allegations that leader – and Tom Cruise best friend – David Miscavige has personally physically abused his followers.

item.title: [+1433] 'Hands off my wife!' (PIC)
item.description: Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao puts a Great Wall between Bush and his wife after his last visit.

item.title: [+1412] The Rage Is Not About Health Care
item.description: Demographics are avatars of a change bigger than any bill contemplated by President Obama or Congress — a change that can’t be repealed.

item.title: [+1351] Why 3D TV is just a pointless gimmick
item.description: 3D is right down there with Smell-O-Vision

item.title: [+1141] Lady Gaga on Chatroulette for "Telephone" [Video]
item.description: Lady Gaga meets newest internet hit app Chatroulette, to provide private shows to her fans!

item.title: [+1077] AP: Republicans Were For Obamas Health Insurance Requirement
item.description: Republicans were for President Barack Obama's requirement that Americans get health insurance before they were against it. Flip-flop...

item.title: [+963] Economists Urge Government to Stop War on Piracy
item.description: In an advisory report two economy professors are urging a government to rethink new anti-piracy legislation currently being drafted. The professors argue that harsher anti-piracy measures will only benefit the large media companies and prominent artists, at the expense of users and upcoming artists.

item.title: [+903] Woman wins $9 million from Wal-Mart, after false accusations
item.description: A Houston woman won a civil lawsuit against Wal-Mart after store employees falsely accused her of trying to exchange counterfeit money orders for cash. She ended up spending two days in jail, and was send a letter from Wal-Mart demanding $200, or they would pursue a shoplifting charge. Jurors agreed she was defamed and gave her $9 million.

item.title: [+889] Community Kills [Pic]
item.description: Too bad. I was looking forward to season two.

item.title: [+798] President Obama Enjoys His Star Wars Pop-Up Books... (PIC)
item.description: The force is strong with Obama! Click Here to check out Star Wars Blog

item.title: [+753] Scientists Create Artificial Leaf That Makes Cheap Hydrogen
item.description: By "biotemplating" the Titanium Dioxide to mimic the light harvesting structures of a leaf the research team was able to get 80x the efficiency of current technologies for producing hydrogen gas. This could lead to cheap, clean hydrogen fuel.

item.title: [+708] Crack Kills (PICS)
[+688] History Of Cartoon Violence (Graph)
[+619] Facebook feud ends in blood, kid defends self with knife
item.description: tl;dr - basically 4 teens went over to a 16 year old's house over some Facebook drama. The lone teen pulls a knife and some people get owned. Now the kid who was sitting at home is being tried as an adult for defending himself.

item.title: [+618] Video Games Need to Stop Playing themselves
item.description: Is the future of gaming too automated? What is happening to my vidya games? Back in my day, you could choose which direction you could would wall-run/jump in, tell your entire RPG party what specific attacks to do, and shoot people when you wanted to. Now? All these games are letting you do is manage your party’s health and look at people.
